intro: Urostachys commutatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Urostachys commutatus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
